Title: http://purl.org/phylo/treebase/phylows/study/TB2:S21962
Abstract:
A new species, Belonopsis heteroclada is described and
illustrated. The fungus, collected on near dead to living stems and
branches of Phyllostachys heteroclada, is characterized by having lyard
or pale brown disc, buff to yellow receptacle, pale brown to brown
hymenium, clavate, cylindrical-clavate or wormlike ascospores, and
semiparasitic to parasitic on host. The phylogenetic position of B.
heteroclada was determined by sequences analysis of the nuclear
ribosomal DNA large subunit. The distinctions between the new species
and related taxa are discussed.
